intro: Rhododendron dissilistellatum, commonly known as the Yunnan rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows at high altitudes, often in moist, well-drained soils. The plant features broad, ovate leaves that are dark green and glossy, and it produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. Rhododendron dissilistellatum is part of the Ericaceae family, which includes many ornamental and ecologically significant plants. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
